about.title: ABOUT ME
about.intro: ðŸ’» I'm a Full-Stack Developer with hands-on experience in building modern web applications, working on the Front-end with React and TypeScript and on the Back-end with Java Spring Boot. I have solid knowledge in SQL, version control with Git, and CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.

list.item2: Focus on quality, maintainability, and developer experience (DX).
list.item3: Collaboration and clear communication in multidisciplinary teams.

about.education: Graduated in Systems Analysis and Development, I'm passionate about technology and always seeking continuous growth. I work with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and value good development practices such as Clean Code and SOLID.

fintrak.title: Fintrak
fintrak.text: Personal finance management app with expense tracking, charts, users, and login. Built with React, TypeScript, and NestJS.

cripto.title: Crypto API
cripto.text: App that consumes a cryptocurrency API and displays a paginated, filterable table using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

portfolio.title: Portfolio V1
portfolio.text: My first personal portfolio, built early in my career and later evolved with new technologies and design.

skills.title: SKILLS
skills.subtitle: Click on the technologies to see the name (tooltip)

html.title: HTML
html.text: HTML is the foundation of every web page. It allows you to create the structure of a website, defining elements such as headings, paragraphs, links, and images.
html.note: Fully mastered technology used daily with semantic consistency.

css.title: CSS
css.text: CSS brings life and style to web pages. With it, you can define colors, fonts, layouts, and much more, making sites visually appealing.
css.note: Strong foundation in styling, responsive layout, and animations.

javascript.title: JavaScript
javascript.text: JavaScript is the magic behind interactive web pages. It allows adding dynamics such as animations, form validations, and much more.
javascript.note: Solid command of the language using libraries and frameworks.

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.text: TypeScript is an enhanced version of JavaScript that adds type safety. It helps prevent errors and makes the code easier to maintain.
typescript.note: Used constantly with React and Next, taking advantage of type safety benefits.

react.title: React
react.text: React is a JavaScript library that simplifies building modern and reactive user interfaces. It makes creating reusable components simple and efficient.
react.note: Strong experience in real projects with components, hooks, and contexts.

nextjs.title: Next.js
nextjs.text: Next.js is a framework that takes React to the next level, offering features like server-side rendering and static site generation easily.
nextjs.note: Intermediate knowledge; used in personal projects and SSR study.

tailwind.title: Tailwind
tailwind.text: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS library that allows styling directly with classes. I use it extensively in my personal projects.
tailwind.note: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS library that allows styling directly with classes. I use it extensively in my personal projects.

zod.title: Zod + React Hook Form
zod.text: Zod and React Hook Form help validate and manage forms, making them safer and more efficient. I also use them frequently when building forms.
zod.note: Used regularly in personal projects; Zod and React Hook Form help validate and manage forms efficiently.

spring.title: Spring Boot & Hibernate
spring.text: Spring Boot simplifies Java application development. With it, you can quickly create robust and scalable apps, using it as a back-end solution.
spring.note: Good foundation in REST APIs with authentication and database integration; used professionally.

sql.title: SQL
sql.text: SQL is a programming language for relational tables. It allows reading, editing, creating, and deleting tables or columns, and much more!
sql.note: Solid experience with SQL Server, especially in queries and modeling.

mongo.title: MongoDB
mongo.text: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that facilitates storing and querying large volumes of data using a flexible, document-oriented structure.
mongo.note: Not yet used in projects but included in the study roadmap.

node.title: Node.js
node.text: Node.js allows using JavaScript on the server, enabling the creation of fast and scalable network applications. It is ideal for building APIs and web services.
node.note: Beginner level; used in simple projects and small applications.

api.title: API REST
api.text: REST APIs are the backbone of communication between modern systems. They allow different applications to exchange data simply and efficiently via HTTP.
api.note: Hands-on experience with JWT authentication, CRUD, and front-back integration.

docker.title: Docker
docker.text: Docker revolutionizes development by allowing you to package applications and their dependencies into containers, ensuring they run consistently in any environment.
docker.note: Basic knowledge; used for testing and deploying personal projects.
